properties.Name: AGREA
properties.description:
CHAMPIONING A NEW NARRATIVE FOR AGRICULTURE
We believe that Filipino Farmers are world class. They are the point of change in our food system. In living our mission we strive for an Ecology of Dignity of all the stakeholders involved in bringing food on our tables. Rich or poor, young or old: everyone needs to eat!

We are focused on making the Philippine archipelago agriculturally sustainable by building on the One Island Economy model guided by three major goals: Zero Hunger, Zero Waste and Zero Insufficiency.

In all our work environmental local impact is a key consideration, by using a transformational approach, we make sure every transaction made with AGREA from producing to bringing food to consumers is contributing to impactful changes in every point along the way.
Website: https://www.agrea.ph/

properties.Name: Permaculture Systems Design Thinking (PSDT)
properties.description:
The course is designed to open the eyes of the learner to critical environmental issues and problems in the country. To address these problems, the learner will be trained in the course to use systems thinking as the guiding paradigm in the design of innovative and practical solutions. The discussions are mostly based on basic principles from earth science, biology, environmental science, and agriculture.

At the end of the course, learners should be able to:

Explain permaculture to non-practitioners, especially family members and friends
Apply permaculture principles and techniques in solving life’s daily design challenges
Integrate permaculture with one’s interests, current discipline or line of work

https://fmds.upou.edu.ph/academics/cep/envi-cluster/permaculture-systems-design-thinking/

properties.Name: 2nd Phil. Perma Convergence (2018), Laguna
properties.description:
2nd Philippine Permaculture Convergence (Permakulturang Pilipino Patungo sa Pagkakaisa)
PPC 2018 was conceptualized based on four subject tracks coined by Landa F. Jocano(2008) Filipino Value Systems - A Cultural Definition: BUTI - Permaculture is a system that protects what’s good in the natural environment. Doing good is based on the concept of feeling great in the spaces where we dwell and work. PAMANATAYAN, the concept of generating eco-system based abundance, should be measured, shared, and sustained for generations. HALAGA or worth, importance, evaluation or assessment does not just put meaning to the other Filipino core values but also provides an opportunity to further improve and take things to the net level. Permaculture is about processing thoughts, how we value relations and the deeds that will generate ecological abundance for all. GANDA encompasses everything that is to be pursued. What is beautiful must be realized with collaboration, extensively manifested over prolonged period while intensely maintained not just by value implementers but the entire population as well.
Website: https://phpermaculture.com/philippine-permaculture-convergence/

properties.Name: 3rd Phil. Perma Convergence (2019), Bohol
properties.description:
3rd Philippine Permaculture Convergence (PERMAKULTURA: PAGSALUNGAT SA NAKAGAWIAN - Sama-samang Pagharap sa Nagbabagong Klima)
The Philippine Permaculture Association, in cooperation with KBoom, the Holy Name University, and Bohol Island State University explored the theme of “NBAU” during its 3rd Permaculture Convergence. The venue was in Tagbilaran, Bohol. We have explored themes of sustainable tourism, green building, and abundance farming visa-vis the current ways of “Business as Usual”. We have invited local speakers who have fi rst hand information and insights. We have also focused on some action-packed adventures that participants can dip their hands into understanding better what the “Not Business-As-Usual” approach is all about
Website: https://phpermaculture.com/philippine-permaculture-convergence/

properties.Name: 2nd Southeast Asian Permaculture Convergence (2015), Isabela
properties.description:
2nd Southeast Asian Permaculture Convergence (SEAPC 2015) served as a platform to advocate permaculture as an effective means to mitigate the disastrous occurrences in our present ecological state. With the theme ―Best Permaculture Practices in Response to Common Disasters. Participants were encouraged to reflect on how permaculture, when applied to practices in fertility, habitat, and social fabric can contribute to a healthier climate and a stable environment capable of yielding abundance. Participants also had the chance to interact and integrate their knowledge on the guided workshops to produce possible solutions to common disasters. Aside from the main conference, side activities were also set up to enrich the whole experience. The Techno Island, divided in four sections (grow, make, prepare, protect), became a venue for demonstrations of sustainable technologies. It was opened to the public for more people to learn and appreciate these grassroots technologies. The public also enjoyed a bazaar promoting organic produce and innovative products. Musical performances kept the energy going. Every night, a community music jamming was held participated by notable local musicians, artists and thespians.
Website: https://phpermaculture.com/philippine-permaculture-convergence/

properties.Name: Layog Country Farm
properties.description:
Cordillera Administrative Region (CAR), Luzon
Site: Olaussen Permaculture Park in Layog Country Farm, Tadian, Mountain Province
Contact Person: Flordelina Layog
Farming the way our forefathers did with the infusion of modern sustainable farming technologies and systems.
It was the dream of a father some fifty years back to have his children root their feet on the land. Never mind if they don't end up as practicing farmers but they should at least be farmers at heart. People who have the true farmers heart he believes have respect for the value of land as a source of life wherever their feet may lead them. That dream was lost among his children who lost their connection to the land. The land lost meaning in their lives as they pursued the material dream. Living in a material world isolates you from your source of life - the land. The land - the environment , suffers from the destruction resulting from unsustainable lifestyles in the material world but if you are having it easy it is easy not to care. The sense of fullfilment having escaped laboring the land under the heat of the sun is a convenient excuse to muffle ones ear so as not to hear the land's groans of pain but for how long.
Dreams have a way of resurrecting themselves and haunting you. The father's daughter and her siblings after forty years now begin to see the wisdom behind the dream. It is time to heed the call to go back to that land their father nurtured and nurture it once again. The lesson that land is life and must be given the respect it deserves must live in their hearts and hopefully into the hearts of each one who see the message in the beauty of a land come alive.
Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/olaussenlayogagroforestgarden/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/layogcountryfarm/
Vlog episode: https://youtu.be/94Z6vQJuxNM

properties.Name: Sierreza
properties.description:
Supporting our katutubo and marginalized farmers and bringing good food to our community.
Fair trade. Farming with a conscience. Healthy living. Heart.<3
Welcome to Los Banos Community-Shared Agriculture! :)
This is our way of supporting katutubo and marginalized farmers --- by securing a weekly demand for their harvest to give them a stable income. This will keep them from having to turn to destructive and dangerous livelihoods (logging, charcoal-making) just to earn fast cash for their everyday needs.
By showing them that a community (or communities) from "siyudad or patag" is willing to purchase their farm-fresh, organic produce at fair prices, they will be encouraged to pursue and learn more about ways to farm fruits and vegetables in a sustainable, eco-friendly, and health conscious way. We call this "farming with a conscience", and hence the term "Community-Shared or Community-Supported Agriculture". :)
Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/Sierreza

properties.Name: The Pitak Project
properties.description:
The Pitak Project is our practice to promote sustainable and regenerative living through natural building and permaculture.

We are women activists with different backgrounds. We’ve been friends for years and lived in Baguio City, a tourist destination located in the mountains of the Cordillera Region in Northern Philippines. Our exposure to economic and social injustice bounded us to choose a path that can show that it’s possible to care for the people, the earth and share its bounties without exploitation. This is The Pitak Project.

The word “pitak” is an Ilocano term for mud. Ilocano is the main language spoken in Northern Philippines. Its Filipino translation is “putik.” We chose the word “pitak” to symbolize the bond of the rich soil and water that gives life. It also embodies our aspiration to build naturally and produce food the permaculture way.
Website: https://thepitakproject.wordpress.com/the-project-site/
Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/Community/The-Pitak-Project-269034733229697/

properties.Name: Homescale Permaculture Learning
properties.description:
Airbnb experience: https://www.airbnb.com/experiences/848691
Contact person: Joepe Jr.
Your Educational Experience will start with the host-visitor meet-up acquaintance & orientation at our site landmark nearby mall City Mall.

A glimpse at Park & Public Market tour for our livestock deep bedding materials source, organic feeds and lifestyle healthy daily routine exercise.

Your experience continue as we reach to the site proper with a startup overview on permaculture live fence guild growing for safety and security of the site.

A warmth welcome and nutrient dense homemade snacks for a break awaits inside the site.

Your learning experience continues w/ (1.)permaculture intro & visual design system guide map for the Homescale Permaculture Setup & Implementation.

The following topics you'll learn on the Educational Experience Tour:
2.) Plant Guild Growing on Vertical Gardens (Air Filter, Mosquito-Insect Repellants, Microgreens, Herbs, Veggies, Fruits)
3.) Water Harvester Growing Medium + DEMO (Hydro-aquaponic System)
4.) Integrated Livestock(Chicken-Duck-Rabbit-Fish-Turtle) for biodegradable Waste Management + Hand Feeding
5.) Fruits-veggies Enzyme Making & Processing + DEMO
6.) LUNCH
7.) GOLF Lesson & Driving
8.) Certificate & Souvenir Giving (Malunggay powder & Multi-functional Mosquito Repellant Sanitizer)
9.) Environmental Stewardship Signing

properties.Name: Lakbay Gulay
properties.description:
Lakbaygulay was born in 2012.
Lakbay is travel in Filipino and Gulay for vegetables. In short, for us, it means ”a traveling vegetarian”. We are a group of young vegetarians, Yoga practitioners and environmental individuals who are engaged in promoting local tourism along with traditional elements of travel—arts, culture, geography, history, and recreation with an integrated combination of voluntary local community service.
Fast forward to today, Lakbaygulay is now our avenue to share our passion. From various advocacies, gardening, cooking and of course, traveling. Our aim is very simple and we hope to use this medium towards achieving selfless service to mankind and God.
Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/lakbaygulay/
YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/TeamLakbaygulay?fbclid=IwAR1Lll57L-Fyg5VBx9VbvgL4trhcw3PK1-1Ov4Sr4SPuw8bliNrQauGqwys

properties.Name: BigNay Farm
properties.description:
BigNay Farm is community organisation set in the background of an organic farm. We aim to create wealth and opportunity through profitable business that does not leave man, or the environment behind.
It's lead founder, Edison Sampang is a New Zealander with a Filipino heritage and a refugee past who has left house and home to move back to the Philippines.
Working with local farmers, business', community and government, BigNay Farm will create an ecosystem of people, knowledge and skills through strategic links with local and international business' and government units in the Philippinines.
Follow the journey and see how small sustainable steps leads to healthier and happier lives for all.

properties.Name: DownToEarth Farm
properties.description:
DowntoEarth produce are grown in the foothills of Mr. Kitanglad, Bukidnon with a strong commitment to sustainability. DowntoEarth animals are raised on pasture by small family farms across Mindanao.

Our farm is one of a few biodynamic farms in the Philippines. We grow our DownToEarth products sustainably: growing flowers, vegetables, herbs without synthetic fertilizers, pesticides, fungicides or herbicides; and raising all our hens, chickens, pigs, lamb and cows on local grasses that are pesticide-free. The animals are raised outdoors and never given antibiotics, steroids or growth hormones. The cows are bull-bred, native cross-breeds and have never been castrated or dehorned. They have not been fed GMO corn or soy, or animal by-products.

OUR FARM PRACTICES

We take great care of our soil and see our farm, our farmers, our plants and animals, the earth and the cosmos, as an entire ecosystem. We practice composting, multiple and crop rotation, cover cropping, ecological pest management and follow a sowing calendar. Aside from sustainable agriculture, our farm encourages careful water use, energy saving initiatives, waste management, product packaging minimization, free trade and the humane treatment of animals. Alongside organic and biodynamic practices, we follow permaculture principles and traditional/native methods that build our soil fertility, while protecting our air, water and wildlife.
Website: http://www.downtoearth.ph/

Call Us: (63)-02-8140854 or 0917-6731947

Email Us: downtoearthorders@gmail.com

Visit our Makati Shop: MAKATI CURB HOLDINGS, No. 7433 Ground Floor, Unit J, Yakal St., San Antonio Village Makati City. (End of Mayapis St., near CASH & CARRY and next to Titania Wine Cellar & near SANTIS Delicacies.)

Read about our Growing Practices: OurFarm Blog

properties.Name: Coffee For Peace Inc.
properties.description:
We're a community of peacebuilders, business owners, and farmers who are practicing inclusive development principles in the coffee industry. We see social entrepreneurship as an approach to achieve justice and harmony in our society and our environment.
Our business offers differentiated coffee products and services to conscientious consumers and businesses by implementing a sustained capacity enhancement of the coffee farming communities. This farmer-focused, community-based strategy improves the coffee quality so that the consumers can be assured of high-quality coffee that is easily traceable to its source. In addition to that, this business provides opportunities for impact investors and other supporters to engage directly with the coffee farmers.
Mindanao, where Coffee for Peace started, is rich with agricultural products and natural resources; hence dubbed as the “land of promise.” However, because of the civil unrest caused by the armed struggle since the Spanish era, the island falls short of its promise. Many people and communities in Mindanao, particularly Bangsamoros and Indigenous Peoples communities suffer from a lack of access to social services. Worst, the way of doing business in most contexts in the Philippines is unjust.
To address this, one of the livelihoods that float our peacebuilding work is coffee. A common drink served and consumed by the majority of the people, whether Muslim, Indigenous People, or migrants. To make this possible, 25% of our net profit goes towards our Peace and Reconciliation Teams (PAR Teams). Our PAR Teams are trained to be agents of peace and reconciliation in their respective communities. They're composed of local volunteers from conflict-affected communities who are paired with international volunteers. They are jointly trained in Fact-Finding Missions, Relief & Medical Operations, Peace Education, Justice Advocacy, Inter-Faith Dialogue, Cross-Cultural Communications, Conflict Transformation, Media Relations, Trauma Healing, Personal Growth & Development.
To learn more about Coffee for Peace, visit us here: http://coffeeforpeace.com
To learn more about the PAR Teams, visit us at
https://peacebuilderscommunity.org/dreams/vision-2020/
Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/coffeeforpeace/
Website: https://www.coffeeforpeace.com/

properties.Name: ReFUGe by Daloy Projects
properties.description:
Daloy Projects is a regenerative enterprise that seeks to build a new model with which to interpret and engage the world, and create a new process for whole-systems design and decision-making. The term “regenerative” pertains to restoring, renewing or revitalizing available sources of energy and materials. A regenerative design aims to create resilient and equitable systems that integrate the needs of community and consider nature’s well-being.

Daloy Projects is about small regenerative attempts using natural flow of energy and available resources to create conditions more conducive to life.

The Regenerative Food Urban Garden (ReFUGe) design seeks to build a model in which to engage the wider community in creating, adapting, and practising a new production process that will build individual, household, and community resilience.

CHARACTERISTICS:
1. Water management system: deals with sourcing, storage, distribution, utilisation, filter, reuse, and injection of water into the soil, ensuring sufficient water supply for domestic and garden needs.
2. Composting system: addresses disposal and processing of compostables such as highly biodegradable food, kitchen wastes and animal manure with other materials such as leaves, cardboards, and papers that are converted into nutritious organic matter for the soil.
3. Food Production: integrates both water management and composting system to grow and produce edible plants for households.
4. Lifestyle: maintenance and operation of the whole system that is appropriate to the capacity of the inhabitants of the household.

Email: daloyprojects@gmail.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/daloyprojects/
Instagram: @daloyprojects

properties.Name: ReFARMED by Daloy Projects
properties.description:
Daloy Projects is a regenerative enterprise that seeks to build a new model with which to interpret and engage the world, and create a new process for whole-systems design and decision-making. The term “regenerative” pertains to restoring, renewing or revitalizing available sources of energy and materials. A regenerative design aims to create resilient and equitable systems that integrate the needs of community and consider nature’s well-being. Daloy Projects is about small regenerative attempts using natural flow of energy and available resources to create conditions more conducive to life.

The Daloy Projects envision an interconnected and holistic economic, ecological and cultural spaces of regenerative attempts at creating more opportunities for life and for all of life in home and community gardens and farms. It aims to: 
-To strengthen resiliency of home-based and community-based food production system through the integration and utilization of compostable wastes and wastewater opportunities at household and community level.
-To integrate regenerative enterprise principles in existing businesses.
-To design and/or redesign farms that not only regenerates the natural environments but revitalizes the community spirit and the culture of the place while being economically resilient in the face of the increasingly uncertain global economic activities.
                                                                                        Regenerative Farm and Enterprise Design and Development  (ReFARMED)
This aims to design, develop and manage land into a scalable and replicable model of a Permaculture-based farm that is responsive and resilient to challenges in the bigger context of changing global climate.                                                                                                                                    Email: daloyprojects@gmail.com                            Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/daloyprojects/

properties.Name: Permaculture Aid Yolanda
properties.description:
Permaculture aid Yolanda for disaster support in the Philippines
PILOT SITE: Batug, Leyte
Batug is a peaceful village of 500 families that had been farming and fishing as a way of life. The campaign “One Block for Batug” had been started by Andrea Roa, a Filipina yoga and breathwork teacher who went back to her village in June 2011 and witnessed the destruction of the only Primary school. The reason was that the school was too close to the river banks that were destroyed by soil erosion and the heavy current from the Daguitan river.

“One Block for Batug” is a community based, registered non-profit project to raise awareness towards the plight of this little village of Barangay Batug and it’s Elementary School. The project intends to raise funds to provide proper classrooms so that the students can continue with their education.
Article: https://ecovillage.org/permaculture-aid-yolanda/

properties.Name: Laguna Volcanic Field
properties.description:
"The Laguna Volcanic Field, also known as the San Pablo Volcanic Field, is an active volcanic field in the Philippines, located between Laguna de Bay, Mount Banahaw volcano complex and Mount Malepunyo range. It is part of the larger Southwestern Luzon Volcanic Field (SWLVF).[2] From Manila, it is about 50 kilometres (31 mi) southeast to Mount Makiling, its most prominent volcanic feature."
Reference: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laguna_Volcanic_Field
